sentences.en: ...a satirical novel about New York life in the late 80s.
sentences.cn: …一部关于80年代末纽约生活的讽刺小说。

sentences.en: " Private Eye " is a satirical magazine.
sentences.cn: 《 私人侦探 》 是一本讽刺性杂志.

sentences.en: English poet and diplomat known for his epigrams and satirical verse.
sentences.cn: 这位诗人也将作为幽默作家和讽刺家被人们怀念.

sentences.en: He has a very satirical eye.
sentences.cn: 他挖苦人的本领特别高明.

sentences.en: His sermons were unpredictably witty and satirical as well as eloquent.
sentences.cn: 没想到的是,他的布道诙谐、机智而且流畅.

sentences.en: His style is at times droll, satirical, yet sympathetic.
sentences.cn: 他的写作风格时而滑稽, 时而讽刺, 有时又饱含同情.

sentences.en: I like Lu Xun's satirical essays.
sentences.cn: 我爱读鲁迅的讽刺杂文.

sentences.en: I like to read Lu Xun's satirical essays.
sentences.cn: 我喜欢看鲁迅的讽刺杂文.

sentences.en: It is here that Twain's satirical vision darkens.
sentences.cn: 吐温那带有讽刺意味的眼光变得更加深沉了.

sentences.en: It presented in satirical terms points made in earnest by Catholic writers.
sentences.cn: 它用讽刺的语言呈现了天主教作家郑重其事表明的观点。

sentences.en: Natalie, silent, regarded them both with a satirical motherly look.
sentences.cn: 娜塔丽默默地用讽刺,但是慈祥的目光望着他们两人.

sentences.en: Swift had been as plain and as satirical, on occasion.
sentences.cn: 斯威夫特的文笔有时同样朴实,同样喜欢讽刺.

sentences.en: There are humorous poems, joking commentaries on the news, and satirical observations of fellow townspeople.
sentences.cn: 有诸如幽默诗, 诙谐的新闻评论, 讽刺当地市民的小品文等.

sentences.en: There were conventional essays " Fire Worship " , " Buds and Bird Voices " ; satirical excursions " The Celestial Railroad ".
sentences.cn: 他的作品有传统的随笔(《拜火 》,《蓓蕾与鸟声》); 又有讽刺性的游记(《通天的铁路 》 ).

sentences.en: This satirical address was a thinly disguised stricture against the doctrine of the rights of man.
sentences.cn: 这一充满讽刺意味的演说几乎是对人权主义不加掩饰的指责.

sentences.en: What a wicked , satirical, pert young man you have become!
sentences.cn: 啊 !你变得多么坏, 多么尖刻,多么淘气!

words.tran_cn: 讽刺；讽刺文学，讽刺作品
讽刺性的；讥讽的；爱挖苦人的

trans.tran_en: A satirical drawing, piece of writing, or comedy show is one in which humour or exaggeration is used to criticize something
